column1: I had finished eating my dinner
column2: set my pail under a clump of trees
column3: and commenced my afternoon job; but
column4: as the log was large and hard
column5: I often had to stop and rest a minute. While I was standing still
column6: with my hands upon one handle of the saw
column7: all at once a bird came flying down towards me; and
column8: after resting upon the ground behind the log a few moments
column9: what do you suppose he did?Whether he knew I was tired
column10: and thought it was too hard for me to cut the wood all alone
column11: I cannot say; but suddenly he gave a little spring
column12: and seated himself right on the other handle of my saw
column13: as you see in the picture
column14: grasping it with all the hands he had
column15: and looking as though he had come on purpose to help me saw that log through.
